title: Indian Toners Extends Anti-Dumping Duty on Black Toner Imports Until 2030
content: Indian Toners & Developers Secures Extension of Anti-Dumping Duty on Black Toner Imports. The anti-dumping duty on "Black Toner in Powder Form" imported from China PR, Malaysia, and Chinese Taipei (Taiwan) will continue, providing a competitive edge for domestic manufacturers. The Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, through notification No. 26/2025-CUSTOMS(ADD) dated August 4, 2025, has extended the duty for five years. The duty will be payable in Indian currency and is effective from August 11, 2025, until August 10, 2030. The extension follows the Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) final findings in Final Report No. 7/12/2024-DGTR, which concluded that ending the duty would likely lead to renewed dumping and harm to the domestic industry. The initial anti-dumping duties were imposed via Notification No. 12/2021-Customs (ADD) dated March 5, 2021. The duty aims to foster a more level playing field for Indian manufacturers. DGTR's review determined that the removal of the duty would likely result in a recurrence of dumping practices. The anti-dumping duty rates, which remain unchanged, are as follows: Anti-Dumping Duty Rates (US$/MT)CountryExporterDuty (US$/MT)China PRTrend Tone Imaging Inc.1,167China PRAll Other Exporters1,568TaiwanTrend Tone Imaging Inc.1,167TaiwanAll Other Exporters1,568MalaysiaAll Exporters1,568 Exclusions to the anti-dumping duty include:Color TonerMICR Toner (Specialized Toner used for printing in Cheques)Toners imported for use by Original Equipment Manufacturers of Printing EquipmentToner in CartridgesToner in liquid formIndian Toners believes that extending the duty will increase the cost of imported black toner, benefiting the company's competitive position against toners from China, Malaysia, and Taiwan. The extension is effective from August 11, 2025, and will continue until August 10, 2030.

title: Smallcap stock gains on announcing acquisition plans - check details
content: Hazoor Multi Projects announced its entry into India's upstream Oil & Gas sector with the acquisition of Quippo Oil & Gas Infrastructure Ltd. (Quippo) via a competitive Swiss Challenge bidding process. The acquisition signals HMPL's strategic expansion into offshore services, a diversification from its existing infrastructure EPC operations, targeting long-term value creation in alignment with national energy priorities. Quippo brings to HMPL a fleet of 14 advanced drilling rigs (650 HP to 3000 HP) and a team of over 400 oilfield professionals. The deal also encompasses diversified service offerings across directional drilling, work-over, cementing, seismic, and integrated field development. According to Mr. Gurinder Kamboj, HMPL's nominee Director on Quippo's board, the acquisition positions HMPL for future growth by integrating its infrastructure capabilities with specialized oilfield expertise. Key benefits cited by HMPL include high-margin recurring revenues from rig leasing and field services, expanded market reach across upstream E&P in India and high-growth international regions, platform synergies with HMPL's EPC, shipyard, and renewable verticals, optionality in strategic adjacencies, and asset-light execution models. Hazoor Multi Projects Ltd. (HMPL), listed on the BSE under symbol HAZOOR, is a Mumbai-based, diversified infrastructure and engineering company with core operations spanning highways, civil EPC works, and shipyard services, now expanding into the Oil and Gas sector. The company emphasizes execution excellence and strategic clarity, building on its track record in capital-intensive projects. HMPL focuses on scalable growth, recurring revenues, and multi-vertical integration within infrastructure, energy, and industrial technology. Such forward-looking statements are subject to certain risks and uncertainties like government actions, local, political, or economic developments, technological risks, and many other factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contemplated by these forward-looking statements. Hazoor Multi Projects Limited and its subsidiaries, associates shall not be in any way responsible for any action taken based on such a statement.

title: Aanchal Ispat Board Approves AGM on Sept 1, Re-appoints Auditors
content: Aanchal Ispat (AANCHALISP): Board Approves AGM Date, Auditor Re-Appointments Aanchal Ispat Limited's board has greenlit arrangements for its 30th Annual General Meeting (AGM), slated for September 1, 2025. The board has also re-appointed statutory and secretarial auditors. M/s Rajesh Jalan & Associates will continue as Statutory Auditors for a second consecutive term of five years. M/s Manisha Saraf & Associates have been appointed as the company's Secretarial Auditor. The AGM is scheduled for Monday, September 1, 2025, at 1:30 p.m. via video conferencing, where audited standalone financial statements for FY25 will be adopted. Shareholders will also vote on the re-appointment of Mr. Manoj Goel and ratification of cost auditor remuneration. Key Board Decisions:Re-appointment of M/s Rajesh Jalan & Associates as Statutory Auditors.Appointment of M/s Manisha Saraf & Associates as Secretarial Auditor.Scheduling of the 30th Annual General Meeting for September 1, 2025.Details September 1, 2025 1:30 PM Video Conferencing AGM Book Closure, E-Voting Timeline Set The register of members will be closed for the AGM. E-voting cut-off is August 25, 2025. Remote e-voting begins on August 29, 2025, at 9:00 A.M. and concludes August 31, 2025, at 5:00 P.M. Purva Sharegistry (India) Pvt Ltd will provide remote e-voting facilities for members to vote electronically on AGM resolutions. AGM notice and related details are available on Aanchal Ispat’s website and stock exchanges' websites. Aanchal Ispat’s 30th Annual General Meeting will be held on Monday, September 1, 2025, at 1.30 p.m.

title: GTV Engineering Secures ₹3.64 Crore Domestic Orders
content: GTV Engineering Limited (BSE: GTV/25) announced it has secured two domestic orders totaling ₹3.64 crore. The orders are for the manufacture and supply of foundation parts for gear units destined for the NTPC Nabinagar Project and NTPC Gadarwara Project. Deliveries are slated to be completed over the next 17 months. The company clarified that the orders, awarded by domestic clients, are subject to standard purchase order terms. GTV Engineering is responsible for manufacturing the parts within the specified timeframe. Furthermore, GTV Engineering confirmed that neither the promoter nor promoter group companies have any stake in the entities awarding the orders, and that these transactions are conducted at arm's length, therefore not qualifying as related party transactions.

title: Taking Stock: Nifty below 24,700, Sensex down 308 pts; autos outshine
content: Indian equity indices erased some of the previous session gains to end on a negative note with Nifty below 24,700 amid selling seen in most of the sectoral indices except auto. At close, the Sensex was down 308.47 points or 0.38 percent at 80,710.25, and the Nifty was down 73.20 points or 0.30 percent at 24,649.55. After a flat start, the indices came under pressure post recent statements from the US President, with Nifty slipping below 24,600, intraday, meanwhile buying in auto stocks helped to trim the losses. Also Read: Services activity remains strong at 60.5 in July: HSBC PMI Among sectors, auto index up 0.4 percent, while bank, IT, oil & gas, FMCG, pharma down 0.5 percent each. BSE Midcap and smallcap indices ended with marginal losses. Infosys, Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports, Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank were among top losers on the Nifty, while gainers were Titan Company, Maruti Suzuki, SBI Life, Trent, IndusInd Bank. Read More: Swiggy, Vishal Mega Mart may join MSCI Standard Index, bringing inflows of $1 billion In stock-specific action, Marico shares fell 1.5 percent after Q1 earnings, IndusInd Bank shares rose as RBI approved the appointment of Rajiv Anand as new CEO, Paytm shares declined 2% after 1.86 crore equity changes hands via block deal, Bosch shares hit 52-week high as Q1 consolidated profit jumps 140%, Triveni Turbine shares fell 8% on weak earnings, Godfrey Phillips India shares surged 10% as Q1 consolidated profit rises 55%. More than 120 stocks touched their 52-week highs on the BSE, including Godfrey Phillips, Vishal Mega Mart, JK Cement, Nuvoco Vistas, TVS Motor, Aditya Birla Capital, Hitachi Energy, Fortis Healthcare, Star Cement, Schneider Infra, CCL Products, Bosch, among others. Click to View More Outlook for August 6 Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities Nifty traded with a negative bias throughout the day, remaining below the 50EMA. On the daily chart as well, the index is comfortably placed below the 50EMA. The current range is 24,400–24,850, and in the short term, the index is likely to remain within this band. Only a decisive move beyond this range might determine the next course of action for the market. Ajit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking Markets reversed Monday’s gains and lost nearly half a percent, continuing the prevailing corrective trend. After an initial downtick, the Nifty moved in a narrow range and finally settled at 24,649.55 level. Most sectors ended in the red, with pharma, FMCG, and realty among the top losers. The broader indices also witnessed a decline, shedding between 0.21% and 0.43%. Lingering uncertainty over the tariff situation, following recent statements from the US President, along with a lack of major positive surprises from the earnings season, has been weighing on market sentiment. All eyes are now on the outcome of the upcoming MPC meeting. While the committee is expected to hold rates steady amid global uncertainties, the tone of their commentary will be crucial. Amid this corrective phase, select stocks across sectors are showing noticeable strength and offering buying opportunities. Participants should therefore maintain a stock-specific approach and focus on prudent position sizing. title: Sensex ends 300 pts lower, Nifty below 24,700 ahead of RBI MPC outcome; auto stocks buck trend
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex ended the session on a weak note as sentiment to a fresh hit after U.S. President Donald Trump warned of a “substantial” hike in duties on Indian exports, citing continued purchases of Russian oil. This follows last week’s threat of a 25 percent tariff and an unspecified penalty. In today's session, all sectoral indices traded in the red, barring auto. The broader market also edged lower by up to 0.8 percent on August 5. At close, the Sensex was down 308.47 points or 0.38 percent at 80,710.25, and the Nifty was down 73.20 points or 0.30 percent at 24,649.55. About 1708 shares advanced, 2184 shares declined, and 143 shares were unchanged. Experts say President Trump's latest tweet warning of a substantial hike in US tariffs on India over its Russian oil imports poses a serious risk. If implemented, it could further strain US-India relations and hit Indian exports to the US harder than previously anticipated. Such a move would also weigh on India's FY26 GDP growth and corporate earnings. "As a result, the market enters a phase of near-term uncertainty. Any escalation in tariffs could trigger a negative reaction, with the Nifty potentially breaching the key support level of 24,500," V K Vijayakumar of Geojit Investments Limited said. Also read: Adani Ports Q1 results: Net profit rises 6% to Rs 3,315 crore, beats estimates Volatility eased slightly, with India VIX down 1.09 percent at 11.84. Among the few gainers, Nifty Auto edged up 0.06 percent, while Consumer Durables posted a marginal gain of 0.04 percent. On the downside, Nifty Oil & Gas fell the most, slipping 1.16 percent, followed by Pharma and FMCG, down 1.08 percent and 0.90 percent, respectively. IT, Infra, and Energy also registered notable losses. Banking indices remained under pressure, with Nifty Bank down 0.72 percent and PSU Bank declining 0.57 percent. The broader market mirrored the trend, with the Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 falling 0.76 percent and 0.37 percent, respectively. Realty stocks also took a hit, dropping 0.87 percent. Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications were down over 2 percent as the firm saw a block deal of 1.86 crore shares, involving 2.9 percent of its total equity in trade on Tuesday, August 5. Earlier, reports had suggested that Antfin (Netherlands) Holding B.V., one of the largest shareholders in the financial services firm, was likely to sell its entire 5.84 percent stake worth Rs 3,803 crore or approximately $434 million via the block deal route. Troubled private lender IndusInd Bank Ltd rallied as much as 5 percent before ending 2 percent higher on the bourses on Tuesday, August 5, after the Reserve Bank of India approved the appointment of Rajiv Anand as the new managing director and CEO. The three-year appointment will run until August 24, 2028, pending shareholder approval at the bank's upcoming general meeting. Read more: NSDL shares likely to list with 17% premium as GMP surges; here's a post-listing strategy The shares of Aditya Infotech made a strong debut on the stock markets on August 5, listing at Rs 1,015 apiece on NSE. This implies a premium of more than 50 percent over the IPO price of Rs 675 apiece. On BSE, the shares however listed with a premium of nearly 51 percent over the IPO price at Rs 1,018 apiece. The stock debuted with a market capitalisation of around Rs 11,900 crore. Technical View Vaishali Parekh, Vice President of Technical Research at Prabhudas Lilladher, said that Nifty staged a pullback and closed above the 24,700 mark, with broader markets also showing signs of recovery. Further gains could be on the cards in the coming sessions. However, for a stronger confirmation of trend reversal, the index must decisively break above its 50-day EMA at 24,906. A sustained move beyond this level could open the door for continued upside. Titan Company, IndusInd Bank, SBI Life Insurance, Coal India and Maruti Suzuki were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Adani Ports, Infosys, Adani Enterprises, Reliance Industries and ICICI Bank. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Unified Data-Tech Solutions Appoints Pranav Parikh as Chief Technology Officer
content: Unified Data-Tech Solutions (UNIFIED: BSE) has named Pranav Parikh as its new Chief Technology Officer, effective August 5, 2025. The appointment was greenlit by the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, the company stated. Parikh brings over 25 years of experience encompassing cloud sales, technical presales, solution architecture, and enterprise IT infrastructure to Unified Data-Tech. He is credited with spearheading cloud transformation projects and boosting revenue through AWS, Azure, Oracle Cloud, and hybrid solutions. According to the company's release, Parikh's expertise spans system integration, datacenter technologies, data protection, cybersecurity, DevOps, and data engineering. His prior leadership roles include positions at Silver Touch Technologies, Tech Data, and Avnet, where he led high-performing teams. Khadija Taher Raniwala, Company Secretary & Compliance Officer, formally disclosed the appointment in a filing dated August 5, 2025. The disclosure is in compliance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. Khadija Taher Raniwala, Company Secretary & Compliance Officer, confirmed the appointment in a filing dated August 5, 2025.
summary_lexrank: Unified Data-Tech Solutions (UNIFIED: BSE) has named Pranav Parikh as its new Chief Technology Officer, effective August 5, 2025.
summary_luhn: Khadija Taher Raniwala, Company Secretary & Compliance Officer, confirmed the appointment in a filing dated August 5, 2025.

title: NLC India shares fall 2.05%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of NLC India declined by 2.05% to Rs 239 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. This price movement reflects a shift in investor sentiment. The stock's decline occurred during the main trading session, with the market open between 09:15 and 15:30. title: Accumulate Kansai Nerolac Paints; target of Rs 277: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Kansai Nerolac Paints Kansai provides a favorable risk reward in near term given 1) strong growth of industrial paints which is 45% of its sales (highest industrial paints share in Industry) 2) likely pick up in 2Q decorative volumes due to early Diwali and sustained gains from paint+ innovations and 3) guidance of steady 13-14% EBITDA margin led by better product mix and improving demand scenario. KNPL plans to maintain its decorative market share led by 1) Innovations and new launches under Paint + initiatives (12% of sales) 2) distribution improvement in Nextgen Nerolac Shoppe (400 added in 1Q26) 3) rising scale and focus on projects business 4) loyalty and influencer program. Outlook in non-auto industrials remains positive led by strong order pipeline across Infra, Railways and Powder coatings etc. Outlook We expect 6/8% volume growth and 100bps margin expansion over FY25-27. We estimate a CAGR of 5.6% in sales and 9.8% in PAT over FY25-27. We value the stock at 28xMar27 EPS (No change) and assign a target price of Rs277 (Rs284 earlier). Retain Accumulate. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Kansai Nerolac Paints - 05082025 - prabhu
summary_lexrank: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Kansai Nerolac Paints Kansai provides a favorable risk reward in near term given 1) strong growth of industrial paints which is 45% of its sales (highest industrial paints share in Industry) 2) likely pick up in 2Q decorative volumes due to early Diwali and sustained gains from paint+ innovations and 3) guidance of steady 13-14% EBITDA margin led by better product mix and improving demand scenario.

title: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation shares fall 1.13% amid volume surge
content: Shares of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation declined by 1.13% to Rs 404.05 in Tuesday's session, amid high volume. This decline reflects a shift in investor sentiment, with the stock experiencing unusual trading activity. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation witnessed high volume and a surge in volume during today's trading session. Financial Highlights Consolidated Financial Performance: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation's financial performance reveals the following trends: The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 109,632.80 Crore, compared to Rs 114,677.63 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 3,066.59 Crore, up from Rs 2,561.94 Crore in March 2024. The EPS stood at Rs 16.06 for the quarter-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 19.09 in March 2024. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 434,106.17 Crore, slightly up from Rs 433,856.51 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 6,855.29 Crore, compared to Rs 14,206.63 Crore in March 2024. The EPS stood at Rs 31.66 for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 112.89 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Hindustan Petroleum Corporation show a P/E ratio of 11.38 and a P/B ratio of 1.50 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.30 as of the year-ending March 2025. title: Adani Ports share price falls 2%, Reliance, ICICI Bank, Infosys among top losers on Nifty 50

title: Buy Jupiter Lifeline Hospital; target of Rs 1750: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on Jupiter Lifeline Hospital In line with our estimates and the consensus, Jupiter Lifeline Hospital reported healthy Q1 figures, with revenue/EBITDA up 21%/22% y/y. PAT, however, dipped a tad, 1% y/y due to higher interest cost and depreciation charges. Highlights: a) 1QFY26 ARPOB was Rs67,300/day, up 13% y/y. b) Overall occupancy in 1Q’26 was 60.1% vs. 63.9% last year. c) IPD and OPD revenues grew 19.6% and 15.5% y/y respectively, indicating strong service utilisation across the hospitals. d) Overall patient volumes increased by 11.7% y/y, reflecting consistent growth across the network. e) Capacity expansions are on track for Indore and Dombivli hospitals. f) In Jan’25, 78 beds were added in the Indore hospital with capex at Rs250m. g) Regulatory approval received for Bibvewadi hospital, Pune; construction to start post monsoon. Outlook We introduce our FY28e estimates and roll forward our valuations to 1HFY28E. We value the stock at 24x EV/EBITDA on 1HFY28e and recommend a Buy, with a revised TP of Rs1,750 (Rs1,700 earlier). title: Buy TBO Tek; target of Rs 1725: Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi's research report on TBO Tek Amid broader macro headwinds (incl. Indo-Pak border tension, the Air India crash and Israel-Iran conflict) affecting travel sentiment, TBO Tek’s Q1 GTV grew ~2.3% y/y to ~Rs81.2bn and its blended take-rate expanded ~100bps y/y to ~6.3% due to the increasing tilt toward highmargin hotels & ancillaries. This resulted in revenue growing ~22.2% y/y to Rs5.1bn (~2.7% above ARe). With continued SG&A investments, EBITDA was Rs779m (largely flat y/y) with margins down ~356bps y/y to ~15.2% (in line with ARe). Ahead, as the company nears the end of a relentless hiring spree (to be completed by Q3 FY26), it is on track for a 22-23% revenue CAGR over 2-3 years with a steady margin expansion from FY27. Outlook We cut our FY27e earnings ~1.5%, introduce FY28e and retain a Buy rating with a higher TP of Rs1,725, ~46x Sep’27 EPS. The stock’s last split was announced on January 27, 2006, with the old face value of Rs 10 split into a new face value of Rs 2. The ex-split date was June 13, 2006. Trading at Rs 3,059.70, Siemens exhibited a notable surge in today's session amid high volume, reflecting active market participation.

title: Voltas share price drops 2.07% in today's session
content: Shares of Voltas declined by 2.07% to Rs 1,314.00 in Tuesday's session, according to the last update at 2:55 pm. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. This movement reflects a decrease from its previous close. Financial Performance: Voltas's financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,767.56 Crore, compared to Rs 4,202.88 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 267.66 Crore, up from Rs 148.96 Crore. The company's annual consolidated revenue has also seen a significant increase, with Rs 15,412.79 Crore in 2025 compared to Rs 12,481.21 Crore in 2024. The net profit rose to Rs 960.28 Crore in 2025 from Rs 386.72 Crore in 2024. title: Buy Coal India; target of Rs 450: Sharekhan
content: Sharekhan's research report on Coal India Company reported a revenue of Rs. 35,842 crore, a decline of 1.7% y-o-y. Volume offtake decreased while the realization was almost flat. Adj. operating profit (ex-OBR) of Rs. 11,126 crore was down 3.6% y-o-y and inline with estimate. Consolidated PAT of Rs. 8,743 crore was down 20.2% y-o-y because of lower other income and higher depreciation. Coal India’s volume growth is expected to improve with the addition of thermal capacities. Also, IPO of its subsidiaries would help in some value unlocking. Outlook Valuation of 6.1x/5.8x its FY26/FY27 EPS estimates is attractive, and the stock offers a high dividend yield of ~7%. We maintain a Buy with an unchanged PT of Rs. 450. title: Alembic Pharma’s June quarter profit grows 15 percent on strong US generics sales
content: Formulations and API manufacturer Alembic Pharmaceuticals reported a 15 percent on-year (YoY) growth in in consolidated net profit for the June quarter at Rs 154 crore, driven by strong growth in the US generics business that saw a 13 percent increase in sales. The consolidated revenue from operations for the June quarter rose by 10 percent to Rs.1,711 crore. EBITDA for the quarter rose 20% to Rs 288 crore, while the EBITDA margin improved 200 basis points to 17 percent. Sales growth in the US generics market were strong, rising by 13 percent to Rs 523 crore, attributed to new launches and increased market share. The company filed 6 ANDA approvals received during the quarter, 223 Cumulative ANDA approvals. Ex-US International generics grew by 21% to Rs. 328 crore for the quarter.The India branded business grew by 5 percent to Rs 599 crore led by good momentum in specialty therapies with Gynaecology, Cardiology, Anti-Diabetic, Ophthalmology and Animal healthcare segments demonstrating healthy growth. -infective and Cough & Cold segments grew in line with represented market performance, with robust operational execution. The company launched 3 new products during the quarter Alembic Pharma spent 8% of its sales as R&D expenditure targeting complex injectables. "We began FY26 on a strong note, delivering revenue growth across all businesses. The growth was driven by a 21% increase in RoW markets, reflecting our strategic expansion and disciplined execution across geographies," said Pranav Amin, Managing Director of Alembic Pharma "Despite ongoing pricing pressure, our US business grew by 13%, supported by volume gains. As weramp up utilization of our new manufacturing facilities and continue to drive costoptimization initiatives, we expect to benefit from improved operating leverage," Amin added.
summary_lexrank: Formulations and API manufacturer Alembic Pharmaceuticals reported a 15 percent on-year (YoY) growth in in consolidated net profit for the June quarter at Rs 154 crore, driven by strong growth in the US generics business that saw a 13 percent increase in sales.
summary_luhn: Formulations and API manufacturer Alembic Pharmaceuticals reported a 15 percent on-year (YoY) growth in in consolidated net profit for the June quarter at Rs 154 crore, driven by strong growth in the US generics business that saw a 13 percent increase in sales.
summary_lsa: 328 crore for the quarter.The India branded business grew by 5 percent to Rs 599 crore led by good momentum in specialty therapies with Gynaecology, Cardiology, Anti-Diabetic, Ophthalmology and Animal healthcare segments demonstrating healthy growth.
summary_textrank: Formulations and API manufacturer Alembic Pharmaceuticals reported a 15 percent on-year (YoY) growth in in consolidated net profit for the June quarter at Rs 154 crore, driven by strong growth in the US generics business that saw a 13 percent increase in sales.

title: Trent, Maruti Suzuki among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: In Tuesday's session, Trent was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. The stock is trading at Rs 5,333.00, a 1.6% increase. Here's a summary of the financial performance and other updates for Trent: Financial Performance: The consolidated financial performance of Trent shows a consistent increase in revenue over the years. Quarterly Results: The quarterly revenue figures show a fluctuating pattern. Revenue for the quarter-ending March 2024 was Rs 3,297.70 Crore, which increased to Rs 4,104.44 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. It further rose to Rs 4,156.67 Crore and Rs 4,656.56 Crore for the quarters ending September 2024 and December 2024, respectively. However, it slightly decreased to Rs 4,216.94 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Net profit also saw fluctuations. It was Rs 670.16 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2024, decreased to Rs 335.61 Crore and Rs 329.29 Crore for the quarters ending June 2024 and September 2024, respectively, before increasing to Rs 470.31 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 312.70 Crore. EPS followed a similar trend, starting at Rs 19.81 for the quarter-ending March 2024, decreasing to Rs 11.04 and Rs 9.53 for the subsequent two quarters, then rising to Rs 13.99 before falling again to Rs 8.95 for the quarter-ending March 2025. Annual Results: The annual revenue saw a consistent increase from Rs 2,592.96 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,134.61 Crore in 2025. The net profit also increased significantly from a loss of Rs -109.77 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 1,447.91 Crore in 2025. EPS increased from Rs -4.11 in 2021 to Rs 43.51 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) also rose from Rs 66.32 in 2021 to Rs 153.64 in 2025. Return on equity (ROE) improved from -6.31% in 2021 to 28.31% in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio remained relatively low, decreasing from 0.00 in 2021 to 0.09 in 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity20212,592.96-109.77-4.1166.32-6.310.0020224,498.0229.462.9867.794.470.2120238,242.02310.2212.5174.9117.130.19202412,375.111,353.8941.82115.4036.550.12202517,134.611,447.9143.51153.6428.310.09The revenue increased by approximately 39.3% in 2025 compared to 2024, and net profit saw an increase of about 7% over the same period.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 20243,297.70670.1619.81Jun 20244,104.44335.6111.04Sep 20244,156.67329.299.53Dec 20244,656.56470.3113.99Mar 20254,216.94312.708.95Corporate Actions Trent Limited has announced a final dividend of Rs 5 per share (500%) with an effective date of June 12, 2025. title: Fortis Healthcare shares hit 52-week high
content: Shares of Fortis Healthcare touched a 52-week high of Rs 867.50 on the BSE, reaching Rs 867.25, a 0.62% increase during Tuesday's trading session. At 1:40 pm, the stock is trading close to its peak, reflecting positive investor sentiment. Financial Performance: Fortis Healthcare has demonstrated steady financial growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 2,007.20 Crore, up from Rs 1,785.88 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 183.38 Crore, compared to Rs 198.82 Crore in the previous year. EPS stood at Rs 2.44 in March 2025, slightly higher than Rs 2.37 in March 2024. The company's annual performance shows consistent revenue and profit growth. Consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 7,782.75 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 6,892.92 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also increased to Rs 797.86 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 635.71 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 10.26 in March 2025 from Rs 7.93 in March 2024. title: Patanjali Foods shares fall 2.13%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Patanjali Foods declined by 2.13%, trading at Rs 1,821.30 in Tuesday's session. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 1:36 pm. On August 4, 2025, Patanjali Foods communicated to shareholders regarding tax deduction at source (TDS) on the final dividend. Additionally, Walker Chandiok & Co. LLP was appointed as the Joint Statutory Auditor of the company on July 28, 2025. A notice to shareholders regarding the re-lodgement of transfer requests for physical shares was published on July 25, 2025. The company has announced a bonus issue of 2:1, with the announcement date being July 17, 2025. Patanjali Foods has announced several dividends in recent years. An interim dividend of Rs 8 per share (400%) was announced on October 22, 2024, with an effective date of November 4, 2024. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) was announced on February 29, 2024, effective from March 21, 2024. A final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) was announced on May 30, 2023, with an effective date of September 21, 2023. The company also announced a final dividend of Rs 5 per share (250%) on May 27, 2022, which was effective from September 23, 2022. The company had a stock split on June 14, 2007, with the old face value of Rs 10 being split to a new face value of Rs 2. The ex-split date was October 29, 2007, and the record date was November 3, 2007. The net profit also improved, from a loss of Rs 87.97 Crore in 2019 to a profit of Rs 1,300.71 Crore in 2025. As per Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for Patanjali Foods is bullish as of today. Patanjali Foods shares declined by 2.13% and were trading at Rs 1,821.30 in the Tuesday afternoon session.

title: Bajaj Finance shares trade flat in today's session; over 27.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Bajaj Finance were trading at Rs 884.40 in Tuesday's session, showing a marginal decline of 0.10% from the previous close. Over 27.5 lakh shares were traded. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 19,523.88 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 18,456.85 Crore in March 2025, Rs 18,035.11 Crore in December 2024, Rs 17,090.27 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 16,098.67 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit has also increased, with Rs 4,764.55 Crore reported for June 2025, up from Rs 4,536.75 Crore in March 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 7.57 for June 2025. Consolidated Yearly Performance: Bajaj Finance has demonstrated substantial year-on-year growth in its consolidated financials. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 69,683.51 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 54,969.49 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also saw a rise, amounting to Rs 16,761.67 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 14,443.53 Crore in March 2024. The company's EPS has steadily increased over the years, reaching Rs 268.94 in March 2025, up from Rs 236.89 in March 2024. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has also risen, with a value of Rs 1,557.43 in March 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) was reported at 17.20% for March 2025, while the debt-to-equity ratio stood at 3.74. The following table presents a summary of the key financial figures:Financials (Consolidated Yearly)Mar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 26,668.10 CroreRs 31,632.42 CroreRs 41,397.38 CroreRs 54,969.49 CroreRs 69,683.51 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,419.82 CroreRs 7,028.23 CroreRs 11,506.02 CroreRs 14,443.53 CroreRs 16,761.67 CroreEPSRs 73.58Rs 116.64Rs 190.53Rs 236.89Rs 268.94BVPSRs 613.67Rs 724.56Rs 899.53Rs 1,241.03Rs 1,557.43ROE11.97%16.07%21.16%18.84%17.20%Debt to Equity3.573.783.993.823.74Income Statement: The total income for year ending March 2025 is Rs 69,724 Crore. Total expenditure is Rs 22,892 Crore, with EBIT of Rs 46,832 Crore. Interest is Rs 24,770 Crore and Tax is Rs 5,300 Crore. Net Profit for year ending March 2025 is Rs 16,761 Crore. The company announced bonus issue and stock split on April 29, 2025, with record date as June 16, 2025 Corporate Actions: The company announced a bonus issue on April 29, 2025, with an ex-bonus date and record date of June 16, 2025, offering a bonus ratio of 4:1. Additionally, a stock split was announced on the same day, with the same ex-split and record date, reducing the face value from Rs 2 to Rs 1. Furthermore, Moody's Ratings assigned Bajaj Finance a new rating of "Baa3 Corporate Family Rating (CFR) with outlook as Stable" on August 4, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 884.40, Bajaj Finance has seen a marginal decline from the previous close in today's session.

title: Subscribe for Knowledge Realty Trust Ltd IPO; Geojit Financial Services
content: Geojit Financial Services, Knowledge Realty Trust Ltd Knowledge Realty Trust (KRT) owns and manages high-quality office portfolio across India. As the country’s largest office REIT by Gross Asset Value (GAV) of ₹61,998.9cr and Net Operating Income (NOI) of ₹3,432.27cr for FY25, KRT maintains a robust and diversified portfolio. As of March 31, 2025, their portfolio includes 6 city-centre offices and 23 business parks/centres, and has a tenant base of over 450 companies, comprising leading Indian corporates such as Aditya Birla Group, PhonePe, HDFC Bank Ltd, and Go Digit, alongside global multinationals including Amazon, Cisco, Google Connect, Novartis, and Siemens Ltd. India achieved record office leasing activity in CY24, with gross absorption reaching 80.3 msf., marking an 18% YoY growth. The number of Global Capability Centers (GCCs) in India grew at a CAGR of 6.1%, rising from over 700 in FY10 to more than 1,800 by February 2025, and is projected to exceed 2,100 by FY28. Valuation and Outlook Considering Knowledge Realty Trust’s leadership in the office REIT space, backed by experienced sponsors and management, strong geographic diversification, high-quality tenant base, projected Net Operating Income (NOI) growth of ~19% over FY26–28E, potential for capital appreciation, attractive dividend yield ( 6% -7%) and a healthy balance sheet with a low loan-to-value (LTV) ratio, we assign a 'Subscribe' rating for long-term. For all IPO report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Knowledge Realty Trust -050825 - geo

title: Bhatia Communications Board to Consider Dividend, Results on Aug 12
content: Bhatia Communications & Retail (India) Limited will convene a board meeting on August 12, 2025, to review and approve standalone unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The board will also consider the declaration of a 1st interim dividend for fiscal year 2025-26. Per company policy, the trading window for directors, officers, designated employees, and their immediate relatives has been closed from July 1, 2025, and will remain closed until 48 hours after the announcement of the June 30, 2025, quarter's unaudited financial results. The meeting is scheduled for 04.00 P.M. at the company’s registered office located at 132, Dr. Ambedkar Shopping Centre, Ring Road, Surat-395002.
summary_lexrank: Bhatia Communications & Retail (India) Limited will convene a board meeting on August 12, 2025, to review and approve standalone unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025.
summary_luhn: Per company policy, the trading window for directors, officers, designated employees, and their immediate relatives has been closed from July 1, 2025, and will remain closed until 48 hours after the announcement of the June 30, 2025, quarter's unaudited financial results.

title: Ipca Laboratories shares fall 2.04%; among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Ipca Laboratories declined by 2.04% to trade at Rs 1,413.70 on Tuesday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This represents a decrease from its previous close. Ipca Laboratories is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty Midcap 150 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 2,246.69 Crore, compared to Rs 2,033.01 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 65.78 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 2.91 Crore in the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 2.67 in March 2025, compared to Rs 2.35 in March 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 8,939.59 Crore, showing an increase from Rs 7,705.04 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also increased to Rs 787.53 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 529.21 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 35.14 in March 2025, compared to Rs 25.82 in March 2024. title: Glenmark Pharma share price falls 2.06% in today's session
content: Shares of Glenmark Pharma declined by 2.06% to Rs 2,032.10 in Tuesday's trading session. The stock's movement reflects a decrease from its previous close, with investors reacting to the day's trading dynamics. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Performance: Glenmark Pharma's recent financial performance showcases a mix of quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,256.21 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 4.38 Crore. The EPS for the same period was Rs 0.16. On an annual basis, the consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 13,321.74 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 1,047.14 Crore and an EPS of Rs 37.11. title: Buy Tube Investments of India; target of Rs 3515: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Tube Investments of India Tube Investments’ (TIINDIA) 1QFY26 PAT of INR1.68b was ahead of our estimate of INR1.61b, primarily aided by higher other income even as EBITDA margin was in line with our estimate. Improved mobility division margin surprised positively. We expect standalone revenue to pick up in the coming quarters, led by supplies to a new Hyundai Pune plant that is likely to commercialize from Oct25, the ramp-up of a new CRSS plant, and the execution of a Railways order from 4QFY26. Adjusted for stakes in CG Power and Shanti Gears, standalone business is attractively valued at 16.4x/14.2x FY26E/FY27E EPS. Reiterate BUY with a TP of ~INR3,515 (premised on Jun’27E SOTP, based on 30x PER for the standalone business, valuing listed subsidiaries at 30% HoldCo discount). Outlook Reiterate BUY with a TP of ~INR3,515 (premised on Jun’27E SOTP, based on 30x PER for the standalone business, valuing listed subsidiaries at 30% HoldCo discount). title: Buy Siemens Energy India; target of Rs 3600: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Siemens Energy India Siemens Energy India (ENRIN) reported a strong set of financials for 3QFY25 with 80% YoY improvement in PAT. Revenue growth improved 20% YoY, and EBITDA margin was strong at 19.1% for the quarter, driven by strong margins in the power transmission segment. Based on the 9MFY25 performance and announced capex, we raise our estimates by 3%/9% for FY26/FY27 to bake in improved execution and margin in the power transmission segment. We reiterate our BUY rating with a revised TP of INR3,600 (based on 60x Sep’27E). Outlook ENRIN is currently trading at 80.9x/54.7x P/E on FY26E/27E EPS. We raise our estimates and value the stock at 60x on Sep’27E EPS. We reiterate our BUY rating with a revised TP of INR3,600. title: Buy NMDC; target of Rs 84: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on NMDC NMDC, the largest domestic iron ore producer, is planning to double its capacity from ~55mtpa to ~100mtpa over the next 4-5 years. With a strong domestic steel demand outlook, steel production is projected to reach 300mt by FY31, which will boost iron ore requirements to ~450-500mt. Hence, with a significant expansion plan, NMDC is well positioned to benefit from the upcoming opportunities. Outlook We reiterate our BUY rating on NMDC with a TP of INR84 (based on 4.5x EV/EBITDA on FY27E). title: Buy Marico; target of Rs 825: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Marico Marico (MRCO) reported consolidated revenue growth of 23% YoY (in line) in 1QFY26. Domestic revenue growth was 27% YoY with volume growth of 9%. International growth was 12% YoY (+19% CC). Domestic revenue growth was driven by strong core category growth and sustained success for its new growth drivers. Parachute coconut oil (PCNO) posted 31% YoY value growth with a 1% volume decline, primarily driven by price hikes. MRCO undertook an additional ~30% price hike in 1QFY26, the full impact of which is expected to be reflected in 2Q. Meanwhile, copra prices have begun to soften, currently down ~12% from their peak. Outlook We model a 13%/12% revenue and EBITDA CAGR during FY25-28E and reiterate our BUY rating on the stock with a TP of INR825 (based on 50x Jun’27E EPS). title: Buy G R Infraprojects; target of Rs 1500: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on G R Infraprojects GR Infraprojects (GRINFRA) reported a ~4% YoY decline in revenue to INR18.3b in 1QFY26, marginally above our expectations, driven by execution ramp-up in new projects. Despite revenue decline, EBITDA margin was healthy at 12.7% (est. 11.8%), aided by operational efficiency. EBITDA fell 6% YoY to INR2.3b, but was ~14% ahead of estimate. Higher operating margins, lower depreciation and lower interest resulted in APAT growth of 14% YoY to ~INR2.2b (24% above our estimate). Outlook We expect GRINFRA to clock a 12% revenue CAGR over FY25-27, with an EBITDA margin in the range of 12-14%. Reiterate BUY with a revised SoTP-based TP of INR1,500. title: Buy Aditya Birla Capital; target of Rs 325: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Aditya Birla Capital Aditya Birla Capital’s (ABCAP) 1QFY26 consolidated revenue grew 10% YoY to ~INR113b, and consolidated PAT also grew ~10% YoY to ~INR8.35b. Overall lending book (NBFC and Housing) grew 30% YoY to ~INR1.66t. Total AUM (AMC, Life insurance, and Health insurance) grew ~20% YoY to INR5.53t. Mutual fund quarterly average AUM grew 14% YoY to INR4.04t. Life Insurance Individual first year premium (FYP) grew ~23% YoY to INR7.95b, and Health Insurance GWP grew ~30% YoY to INR13.5b. Outlook We expect a consolidated PAT CAGR of ~24% over FY25-27. The thrust on cross-selling, investments in digital, and leveraging ‘One ABC’ will lead to healthy return ratios, even as we build in a consolidated RoE of ~14% by FY27. Reiterate BUY with an SoTP (Mar’27E)-based TP of INR325. title: Buy ABB India; target of Rs 6000: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on ABB India ABB India’s 2QCY25 results were lower than our estimates as margins contracted significantly owing to forex fluctuations, quality control order (QCO) implementation and competitive pricing. Order inflows declined 12% YoY, while base ordering was strong. Demand remained sluggish across segments during 2QCY25 and is still far off from the highs seen two years ago. We cut our estimates by 15%/8%/2% for CY25/26/27 to bake in lower margins. ABB is currently trading at 63.7x/53.6x/45.6x on CY25E/CY26E /CY27E earnings. We believe that in the near term, ABB can underperform due to margin pressure and sluggish ordering activity in the private and government sectors. However, in the long run, we expect ABB to 1) improve its margins once the QCO implementation is over in the next few quarters and 2) improve its revenue once ordering activity starts ramping up. We, thus, maintain BUY with a revised DCF-based PT of INR6,000, implying 55x Sep’27E earnings. Scope of rerating back to higher multiples will emerge once inflows and margins start showing an improving trend. Outlook We believe that in the near term, ABB can underperform due to margin pressure and sluggish ordering activity in the private and government sectors. However, in the long run, we expect ABB to improve its margins once the QCO implementation is over in the next few quarters and revenues once ordering activity starts ramping up. We, thus, maintain BUY with a revised DCF-based TP of INR6,000, implying 55x Sep’27E earnings. The scope of re-rating back to higher multiples will emerge once inflows and margins start showing an improving trend. title: Buy Radico Khaitan; target of Rs 3250: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Radico Khaitan Radico Khaitan reported strong revenue growth of 32% YoY (est. 22%) in 1QFY26, with total volume growing 37% (beat). The Prestige & Above (P&A) segment clocked volume and value growth of 41% and 43%. Regular segment posted 48% value growth and 52% volume growth, aided by a low base, resolution of state-specific issues, and route-to-market changes in Andhra Pradesh (Oct’24). Excluding AP, total volume growth stood at ~12%, with P&A volume growth at ~20%. The market share in AP increased sharply from 10% in 1HFY25 to 28% in 1QFY26. Non-IMFL delivered moderate revenue growth of 12% due to lower bulk alcohol sales. Outlook We believe a ~30% EPS CAGR provides adequate support for sustaining rich valuations. We value the company at 60x P/E on Jun’27E EPS to derive a TP of INR3,250. title: Buy Power Grid Corporation of India; target of Rs 345: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Power Grid Corporation of India In 1QFY26, Power Grid Corporation (PWGR) reported a standalone (SA) revenue of INR99.3b (-1% YoY), 6% below our estimate. EBITDA was 12% below our estimate at INR81.2b (-7% YoY), hit by a 66% YoY surge in other expenses. Adj. SA PAT was 6% below our est. at INR34.7b, supported by higher-than-expected other income and lower tax expenses. In the analyst meet, management reiterated its robust capex trajectory, improving capitalization trends, and a strong project pipeline. Capex guidance remains unchanged at INR280b/INR350b/INR450b for FY26/FY27/FY28, respectively. However, the capitalization target for FY26 has been slightly revised downward to INR220b (vs. earlier guidance of INR230–250b), owing to persistent issues related to right-of-way (RoW). Outlook We derive our TP of INR345 for PWGR based on FY27E BVPS and a P/B multiple of 3x, which we believe is reasonable given that its capex and capitalization are on a multi-year uptrend with the order book at an elevated level. title: Buy Mankind Pharma; target of Rs 2990: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Mankind Pharma Mankind Pharma (Mankind) reported in-line revenue in 1QFY26. However, EBITDA/PAT came in 5%/7% below our estimates. Higher operational costs at the start of the financial year, coupled with increased interest costs and depreciation, affected earnings for the quarter. After the implementation of corrective measures in the prescription (Rx) segment of the domestic formulation (DF) category over the past two years, the benefits are now visible to some extent, with Mankind outpacing industry growth in Rx in 1QFY26. Notably, Mankind outperformed the industry in volume, along with superior growth in chronic therapies. Outlook We value Mankind at 45x 12M forward earnings to arrive at a price target of INR2,990. title: Buy Go Fashion India; target of Rs 988: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Go Fashion India Go Fashion (India) Ltd (GOCOLORS) reported a muted start to FY26, with revenue growing modestly at 1% YoY, impacted by a 2% SSSG decline driven by weak footfalls, supply chain disruptions due to Bangladesh import restrictions, and a 13% YoY revenue drop in the LFS channel amid partner-related challenges. Employee costs increased ~300bp YoY, reflecting a higher headcount from new store additions and annual salary increments. Outlook At 40x one-year forward EPS, the stock trades below its historical average. We reiterate our BUY rating with a TP of INR 988, based on 40x Sep’27E EPS. content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company Cholamandalam Inv. & Finance (CIFC)’s 1QFY26 PAT grew ~21% YoY to INR11.4b (in line). Its 1Q NII grew ~24% YoY to ~INR31.8b (in line). Other income increased ~48% YoY to ~INR6.8b (~16% above est.), primarily driven by upfront assignment income of ~INR1.5b (PQ: INR940m). Reiterate BUY with a TP of INR1,650 (premised on 3.8x Mar’27E BVPS). content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Blue Dart Express Blue Dart Express (BDE) revenue grew 7% YoY to INR14.4b (in line). The company handled 0.34m tons of cargo volumes (+9% YoY) in 1QFY26. title: Hold HealthCare Global Enterprises; target of Rs 590: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on HealthCare Global Enterprises HealthCare Global Enterprises’ (HCG) Q1FY26 result was in line with our expectations. Revenue grew 16.7% YoY driven by new centres in Mumbai (+28% YoY), Kolkata (+17% YoY) and Ahmedabad (+22% YoY) while key cluster of Karnataka and East India grew at a moderate pace. title: Hold ABB India; target of Rs 4850: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on ABB India ABB India (ABB) reported disappointing numbers in Q2CY25 on both ordering and financial fronts. While the orderbook (OB) was healthy at INR 100.6bn as of Jun’25 (book-to-bill of 0.8), order inflow (OI) fell 12% YoY. The decline was due to dip in large orders, while base orders were up 5% YoY. ABB attributed the dip to sluggish domestic demand as private capex was delayed due to macro uncertainties. ABB also reported margin contraction in Q2, partly due to lower gross margin (higher import content), a one-off cost, forex losses, and adverse revenue mix. EBITDA margin was down ~610bps YoY, dragging the EBITDA/PAT to INR 4.1bn/ 3.5bn (-24%/-20% YoY). Outlook We expect near-term outlook to be slightly negative in terms of both OI and profitability; green shoots in OI especially large orders, is a key monitorable. Maintain HOLD with a revised TP of INR 4,850, valuing the stock at 50x CY26E earnings. title: Sell LIC Housing Finance; target of Rs 500: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on LIC Housing Finance LIC Housing Finance (LIC HF) continues to feel the heat from increasing competition, as reflected in AUM growth remaining subdued at 7% YoY / 1% QoQ and asset yield reducing 20bps YoY / QoQ to 9.6% in Q1FY26. However, NIM expanded 3bps YoY driven by a 26bps YoY dip in cost of funds to 7.5%, offsetting the adverse impact of yield contraction on NIM in Q1. Incremental yields were lower by 50bps at 8.9%, while cost of funds was down 69bps QoQ to 6.97%; hence, it expects NIM to sustain at the current level of 2.1%. Credit cost in Q1 inched up to 25bps vs. the guided range of 9-15bps in FY26. Outlook We believe increased competition in prime housing post rate cut would keep growth and earnings muted for LIC HF in the near term. Maintain SELL with an unchanged TP of INR 500, valuing the stock at 0.6x Sep’26E BVPS. title: Buy Shree Cement; target of Rs 35,330: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on Shree Cement Shree Cement’s (SRCM) Q1FY26 volume declined 7% YoY, yet the EBIDTA surged 34% YoY led by price hikes. With blended realisation rising ~4% QoQ (up 10% YoY), EBITDA/t catapulted 44% YoY (down a mere 2% QoQ) to INR 1,373. The performance was largely in sync with the company’s guidance to prioritise value over volume. With underlying prices remaining largely stable and reduced competitive intensity hinting at further uptick, we continue to repose faith in SRCM and broadly maintain our earnings estimates. Also, the low base for Q2 and Q3 last year may ensure volume recovery, coinciding with our forecast of industry-wide demand recovery (especially post the ongoing monsoon quarter). Outlook We continue to value SRCM at 19x FY27E EV/EBITDA and maintain BUY with an unchanged TP of INR 35,330. title: Buy Ajax Engineering; target of Rs 900: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities research report on Ajax Engineering Ajax reported a muted set of numbers in Q1FY26 with revenue and volume flat YoY. Sale of slipform pavers (~5% of revenue) in base quarter aided EBITDA margin of 17.1% in Q1FY26 (vs. 15.6% in FY25). EBITDA margin in Q1 fell to 13.2% (-390bps YoY; -230bps QoQ) due to 1) cost increase on transition to CEV-V, 2) flat realisation (no price hike), and 3) lower fixed cost absorption. Thus, EBITDA was down 23% to INR 1.2bn. While the move to CEV-V compliant vehicles has been mandated since Jul’25, Ajax has sold 30% and 90% of CEV-V SLCMs in Q4FY25 and Q1FY26, respectively. The impact on margins is visible as well. Outlook Thus, we expect gross margin to dip 150-200bps in FY26E despite an estimated price hike of 4% in H2FY26E. Maintain BUY with TP of INR 900 (based on 28x FY27E EPS). title: Coforge share price falls 2.04% in Tuesday's session
content: Shares of COFORGE LIMITED declined by 2.04% to trade at Rs 1,710.90 in Tuesday's session. The stock is currently trading on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. At 12:55 pm, the stock saw negative movement compared to its previous close. On August 1, 2025, COFORGE LIMITED announced the resignation of Mr. Gautam Samanta as President & Executive Director of the Company, effective October 10, 2025. The company also announced the transcript of earnings call for Q1 FY 2026 on July 31, 2025 and appointment of Manish Hemrajani as head of Investor Relations on July 28, 2025. In recent corporate actions, the company announced an interim dividend of Rs 4 per share (200%) with effective date as July 31, 2025. title: Triveni Turbine shares slip 9% on weak Q1; order delays, export weakness drag performance
content: Shares of Triveni Turbine slumped as much as 9 percent to Rs 540 on Tuesday, August 5, after the company posted a weak set of earnings for the June quarter, marred by sluggish domestic and export performance. In Q1 FY26, the turbine maker’s consolidated revenue dropped 20 percent year-on-year to Rs 371.3 crore, down from Rs 463.3 crore in the same period last year. Both key business segments struggled—domestic revenue fell 24 percent to Rs 188.2 crore, while exports slipped 15 percent to Rs 183.1 crore. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Despite pressure on the top line, other income rose 14 percent year-on-year to Rs 22.2 crore. Gross margin improved slightly to 52.17 percent, up 32 basis points from a year ago. However, operating performance remained under strain—EBITDA declined 23 percent to Rs 73.6 crore, with margins narrowing to 19.8 percent, down 81 basis points. Net profit also shrank 20 percent year-on-year to Rs 64.4 crore. The management attributed the weak quarter to geopolitical uncertainties, which disrupted operations by delaying inspections and pushing order dispatches into later quarters. Export-linked demand also remained subdued, both for equipment and aftermarket services. A high base from last year—boosted by large export orders—further skewed the year-on-year comparison. Calling it a "challenging quarter," Chairman and MD Dhruv Sawhney acknowledged the results fell short of expectations but said the company is actively working to recalibrate operations. He remained optimistic about Triveni's long-term growth path, despite near-term headwinds. At about 12:50 pm, shares of the company were trading at Rs 551, lower by 7 percent from the last close on the NSE. Triveni Turbine shares are down 26 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: In Q1 FY26, the turbine maker’s consolidated revenue dropped 20 percent year-on-year to Rs 371.3 crore, down from Rs 463.3 crore in the same period last year.
summary_luhn: Shares of Triveni Turbine slumped as much as 9 percent to Rs 540 on Tuesday, August 5, after the company posted a weak set of earnings for the June quarter, marred by sluggish domestic and export performance.

title: Infosys share price declines 1.22% in intraday trade
content: Shares of Infosys were trading lower in Tuesday’s session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,462.40 on the NSE, a 1.22% decline from the previous close as of 12:40 pm. Earlier today, the stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,478.70 and a day's low of Rs 1,455.00. Financial Highlights Infosys has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the past few years. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 40,925 Crore in March 2025. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 6,924 Crore, slightly down from Rs 7,038 Crore in the previous quarter. The following table presents a summary of Infosys's quarterly financial performance:ParticularsJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024RevenueRs 42,279 CroreRs 40,925 CroreRs 41,764 CroreRs 40,986 CroreRs 39,315 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,924 CroreRs 7,038 CroreRs 6,822 CroreRs 6,516 CroreRs 6,374 CroreEPS16.7016.9816.4315.7115.38 The company's annual financial performance also reflects steady growth. For the year-ending March 2025, Infosys reported revenue of Rs 162,990 Crore, up from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 26,750 Crore, compared to Rs 26,248 Crore in the previous fiscal year. Here is a summary of Infosys's annual financial performance:ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021RevenueRs 162,990 CroreRs 153,670 CroreRs 146,767 CroreRs 121,641 CroreRs 100,472 CroreNet ProfitRs 26,750 CroreRs 26,248 CroreRs 24,108 CroreRs 22,146 CroreRs 19,423 CroreEPS64.5063.3957.6352.5245.61BVPS231.11212.74183.17180.50180.75ROE27.8729.7731.9529.3425.34Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00 Infosys’s income statement provides further insights into its financial health. The annual sales for March 2025 reached Rs 162,990 Crore, with other income contributing Rs 3,600 Crore, bringing the total income to Rs 166,590 Crore. The total expenditure amounted to Rs 128,566 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 38,024 Crore. After accounting for interest and tax, the net profit stood at Rs 26,750 Crore. Corporate Actions Infosys has a history of rewarding its investors through dividends and bonus issues. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share was announced on October 17, 2024 and was effective from October 29, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue occurring on July 13, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. Moneycontrol analysis suggests a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 5, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,462.40, Infosys has seen some volatility in today's session.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares fall 0.54% in today's session; over 3.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,530, a 0.54% decline from the previous close, at 12:20 pm. Traded volume stood at over 3.5 lakh shares on the NSE. Financial Performance: Hindustan Unilever's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in both quarterly and yearly results. Consolidated Quarterly Results: The company's revenue and net profit have shown growth in the latest quarter. Here’s a summary of the consolidated quarterly results:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreRs 16,514.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreRs 2,769.00 CroreEPS11.1111.0312.7010.4811.73The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 16,514.00 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 15,707.00 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,769.00 Crore, up from Rs 2,614.00 Crore in the previous year. Consolidated Yearly Results: The annual financial performance also indicates consistent growth. Key figures include:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The revenue for the year ending March 2025 reached Rs 63,121.00 Crore, reflecting a growth of 2.0% compared to Rs 61,896.00 Crore in March 2024. The net profit increased to Rs 10,679.00 Crore, up from Rs 10,286.00 Crore in the previous year. The Return on Equity (ROE) also saw an increase, reaching 21.55% in March 2025 from 20.06% in March 2024. title: New India Assur, Tata Inv Corp among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: New India Assur and Tata Inv Corp emerged as top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 in Tuesday's trading session. At 12:30 pm, New India Assur was trading at Rs 204.33, reflecting an 8.97% increase, while Tata Inv Corp stood at Rs 7,286, marking a 4.44% gain. Other notable gainers on the index included UNO Minda (up 3.76%), Motherson SWI (up 2.8%), and Schaeffler Ind (up 2.77%).New India Assurance Company Ltd.New India Assur experienced positive momentum in Tuesday's session. The following sections detail the company's financial performance and recent corporate actions.Financial PerformanceThe following table summarizes New India Assurance's consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,417.91 CroreRs 10,785.91 CroreRs 10,702.92 CroreRs 11,008.74 CroreRs 11,080.52 CroreNet ProfitRs 232.80 CroreRs 73.56 CroreRs 344.26 CroreRs 321.57 CroreRs 392.40 CroreEPS1.450.542.122.182.43The company's revenue demonstrated a steady increase over the quarters, moving from Rs 10,417.91 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 11,080.52 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also rose, with a significant increase noted in the quarter ending June 2025. The table below presents New India Assurance's consolidated annual financial performance:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 33,066.09 CroreRs 35,820.54 CroreRs 41,007.35 CroreRs 43,675.87 CroreRs 41,238.24 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,627.75 CroreRs 177.92 CroreRs 1,061.29 CroreRs 1,091.12 CroreRs 972.22 CroreEPS9.951.186.366.776.29BVPS155.37156.92157.29172.00175.94ROE6.410.754.053.943.57Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The annual data reveals a fluctuating revenue trend, with a decrease in the year ending March 2025. The net profit also decreased in fiscal year 2025 compared to fiscal year 2024. The company's debt-to-equity ratio has remained at zero over the past five years, indicating a debt-free status. Sales for the year ending March 2025 amounted to Rs 41,238 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 43,675 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 972.22 Crore, lower than the Rs 1,091.12 Crore reported in the previous year.Corporate ActionsRecent corporate actions for New India Assurance, as per announcements, include:Increase In VolumeAnnouncement under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Analyst / Investor Meet - OutcomeAnnouncement under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Change in ManagementThe company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.06 per share on May 22, 2024, effective September 6, 2024. Additionally, a bonus issue with a ratio of 1:1 was announced on May 11, 2018, with an ex-bonus date of June 27, 2018.Tata Investment Corporation Ltd.Tata Inv Corp is also experiencing upward movement in today's session. Let's examine the company's financial performance alongside recent corporate actions.Financial PerformanceA summary of Tata Investment Corporation's consolidated quarterly financial performance is provided below:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 142.46 CroreRs 142.48 CroreRs 3.71 CroreRs 16.43 CroreRs 145.46 CroreNet ProfitRs 106.78 CroreRs 100.50 CroreRs -6.64 CroreRs 8.50 CroreRs 112.40 CroreEPS25.9124.453.887.4628.92The company's revenue and net profit demonstrated fluctuation throughout the quarters, with a notable dip in the quarter ending December 2024, followed by a strong rebound in June 2025. The subsequent table presents Tata Investment Corporation's consolidated annual financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 163.14 CroreRs 253.85 CroreRs 277.16 CroreRs 383.12 CroreRs 305.08 CroreNet ProfitRs 129.91 CroreRs 196.61 CroreRs 216.09 CroreRs 320.32 CroreRs 209.14 CroreEPS30.4442.3449.7876.0961.68BVPS2,814.663,889.253,868.675,922.516,144.99ROE1.081.081.281.281.00Debt to Equity0.000.000.010.000.00The annual figures indicate a fluctuating revenue trend, with a decrease in 2025. The net profit also decreased in 2025 compared to 2024. The company's debt-to-equity ratio has remained low over the past five years. Sales for the year ending March 2025 were Rs 305.08 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 383.12 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 209.14 Crore, also lower than the Rs 320.32 Crore reported in the year prior.Corporate ActionsRecent corporate actions for Tata Investment Corporation include:Tata Investment Corporation Limited has submitted to the Exchange, the financial results for the period ended Jun 30, 2025 and Sub-Division of Ordinary Equity SharesAnnouncement under Regulation 30 (LODR) - Amendments to Memorandum & Articles of AssociationAnnouncement under Regulation 30 (LODR)-Code of Conduct under SEBI (PIT) Regulations, 2015The company announced a final dividend of Rs 27.00 per share on April 21, 2025, effective June 10, 2025. In addition, the company has a history of bonus issues and rights issues, reflecting its capital restructuring activities. With New India Assur trading at Rs 204.33 and Tata Inv Corp at Rs 7,286, both stocks reflect significant gains within the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: UNO Minda shares surge 3.76% amid high volume in today's session
content: Shares of UNO Minda were up 3.76% to Rs 1,102 in Tuesday's session, witnessing high volume. The stock gained momentum amid high volume and was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, UNO Minda has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 4,528.32 Crore, up from Rs 3,794.02 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 234.57 Crore, slightly lower than Rs 243.52 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 4.63, compared to Rs 5.04 in March 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 16,774.61 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 14,030.89 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 840.29 Crore, up from Rs 739.28 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 16.42, compared to Rs 15.36 in March 2024. title: Bharti Airtel shares among top gainers on Nifty 50, rise 0.98%
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading higher on Tuesday, with the stock priced at Rs 1,933.30, a gain of 0.98% in today's session. The stock was identified among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index at 12:10 pm. Bharti Airtel is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 172,985.20 Crore, an increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 33,778.30 Crore, a substantial rise compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024. The company's EPS was Rs 58.00 for March 2025, up from Rs 13.09 in March 2024. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of the year-ending March 2025.Financials (Consolidated Yearly)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet Profit-Rs 23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-Rs 27.65Rs 7.67Rs 14.80Rs 13.09Rs 58.00BVPSRs 147.90Rs 164.46Rs 210.95Rs 216.40Rs 226.16ROE-Rs 25.58Rs 6.39Rs 9.19Rs 7.39Rs 25.58Debt to EquityRs 2.20Rs 2.00Rs 1.82Rs 1.50Rs 1.13The company has announced several corporate actions, including press releases and investor meets. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share on May 13, 2025. Prior to this, final dividends of Rs 8.00, Rs 4.00 and Rs 3.00 were announced on May 14, 2024, May 16, 2023 and May 17, 2022, respectively. Moneycontrol's sentiment analysis, conducted on July 30, 2025, indicates a neutral outlook on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,933.30, Bharti Airtel has shown positive movement and is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index during today's trading session.

title: Q1 Results impact: Godfrey Phillips shares rally 10% to hit all-time high, Oswal Pumps rises 2%, Crizac down 3%
content: The shares of Godfrey Phillips rallied nearly 10 percent to hit a fresh all-time high level on August 5 after the firm released its results for the first quarter of the April-June quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026. The firm also announced a bonus issue for its shareholders. Oswal Pumps shares meanwhile gained more than 5 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 788 apiece. Crizac shares however tumbled nearly 3 percent to trade at Rs 314 apiece. Godfrey Phillips Q1 Results Tobacco manufacturer Godfrey Phillips India on August 4 reported a 64 percent on-year jump in net profit for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 at Rs 365 crore. It had reported a net profit of Rs 223 crore in the year-ago period. The firm's revenue rose 34 percent on-year to Rs 1,807 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 1,352 crore a year ago. The firm's board approved 2-for-1 bonus share issue and fixed September 16 as record date. This means that eligible shareholders will receive 2 bonus shares for every single share they own as on the record date. Godfrey Phillips shares have gained more than 7 percent in the past five days, and nearly 16 percent in the past one month. The stock rallied more than 112 percent in the past six months, and is up over 96 percent in 2025 so far. Oswal Pumps Q1 Results Oswal Pumps on August 4 reported a net profit of Rs 95 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a 34 percent on-year increase from the Rs 70 crore net profit reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. The firm’s revenue from operations meanwhile rose 37 percent on-year to Rs 514 crore in Q1 FY26. It had earlier reported revenue from operations at Rs 376 crore in Q1 FY25. The shares of the company had made a muted stock market debut in June this year, listing with a premium of 3 percent over the IPO price at Rs 634 apiece on NSE. The stock has gained nearly 5 percent in the past five days, and over 8 percent in the past one month. It has so far gained 21 percent since its market debut. Crizac Q1 Results: Crizac on August 4 reported a net profit of Rs 46 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a rise of over 10 percent on-year from the Rs 41 crore net profit reported in Q1 FY25. However, the net profit fell more than 8 percent sequentially from the Rs 50 crore reported in Q4 FY25. The firm’s revenue from operations meanwhile rose 30 percent on-year, but fell 38 percent sequentially to Rs 209 crore. Crizac shares had made a decent market debut in July this year, listing at nearly 15 percent premium over the IPO price at Rs 281 apiece on NSE. The stock has so far gained more than 2.5 percent since then. Also read: Our LIVE blog on Q1 updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: However, the net profit fell more than 8 percent sequentially from the Rs 50 crore reported in Q4 FY25.
summary_luhn: The shares of the company had made a muted stock market debut in June this year, listing with a premium of 3 percent over the IPO price at Rs 634 apiece on NSE.
summary_lsa: This means that eligible shareholders will receive 2 bonus shares for every single share they own as on the record date.

title: Neutral Shree Cement; target of Rs 33000: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Shree Cement Shree Cement’s (SRCM) 1QFY26 operating performance was in line with our estimates. EBITDA increased ~34% YoY to INR12.3b and EBITDA/t rose ~44% YoY to INR1,373 (est. INR1,325). OPM surged 5.9pp YoY to ~25%. PAT grew ~95% YoY to INR6.2b (~39% beat), mainly led by lower depreciation and higher other income than our estimates. Management noted that industry demand is expected to grow by 6-7% YoY in FY26, aided by strong government capex, rising rural housing demand on a good monsoon, increasing urbanization and industrial activities. In Apr’25, SRCM commissioned capacities at Baloda Bazar, Chhattisgarh (3.4mtpa), and Etah, Uttar Pradesh (3.0mtpa), taking total grinding capacity to 62.8mtpa. It has also reiterated its capacity target of 80mtpa by FY28. Outlook We estimate a CAGR of 9%/18%/24% in revenue/EBITDA/PAT over FY25-28. We estimate a volume CAGR of ~7% over FY25-28 and EBITDA/t of INR1,344/ INR1,416/INR1,480 in FY26/FY27/FY28 vs. INR1,086 in FY25E. The stock trades fairly at 21x/18x FY26E/FY27E EV/EBITDA. We maintain our Neutral with a TP of INR33,000 (valuing it at 18x Jun’27E EV/EBITDA). title: Neutral MCX; target of Rs 8300: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on MCX MCX posted a 59% YoY growth in operating revenue, reaching the bestever quarterly revenue of INR3.7b (in-line), backed by volume growth of 77% YoY. Total expenses rose 29% YoY to INR1.3b, driven by 40%/25% YoY increase in other expenses and staff costs. EBITDA stood at INR2.4b (+82% YoY) in 1QFY26, reflecting an EBITDA margin of 64.8% vs 56.6% in 1QFY25. Strong revenue growth, coupled with a 73% YoY growth in other income, resulted in 83% YoY growth in PAT to INR2b (in line). While maintaining operational efficiency remains a key focus area for MCX, EBITDA margin is expected to remain under pressure in the near term, owing to weak volume trends and continued investments in tech and personnel. Outlook We have cut our EPS estimates for FY26/27 by 4%/7%, factoring in higher employee costs, slowdown in futures volumes, and lower premium to the notional turnover ratio. We reiterate a Neutral rating on the stock with a one-year TP of INR8,300 (premised on 42x FY27E EPS). title: Neutral LIC Housing Finance; target of Rs 650: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on LIC Housing Finance LIC Housing Finance’s (LICHF) 1QFY26 PAT grew ~5% YoY to ~INR13.6b (in line). NII in 1QFY26 rose ~4% YoY to ~INR20.7b (in line). Fee and other income grew 170% YoY to INR1.2b. Opex grew ~12% YoY to INR2.9b (~17% lower than est.) and the costincome ratio rose ~50bp YoY to ~13.4% (PY: ~12.9% and PQ: ~19.4%). PPoP grew ~7% YoY to ~INR18.9b (in line). Reported yields declined ~20bp QoQ to 9.6%, while CoB declined ~25bp QoQ to ~7.5%. This resulted in spreads improving ~5bp QoQ to ~2.1%. NIM contracted ~20bp QoQ to ~2.68%. Outlook LICHF’s valuation of ~0.7x FY27E P/BV reflects the inability of the franchise to deliver stronger loan growth. We estimate a CAGR of just ~8%/3% in advances/PAT over FY25-27 and RoA/RoE of 1.6%/13% by FY27. Reiterate our Neutral rating on the stock with a TP of INR650 (based on 0.8x Mar’27E BV).
